Sequence Information.Peptide Name: SP-B (Pro-rich; PrAMPs, natural AMPs; pigs, mammals; animals; UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: porcine salivary gland granules,Sus scrofa domesticus

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis:  APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (60.71%) toSP-Ea proline-rich peptide (67%).Activity: Active against fungi C. albicans UP10 (EC50 34.69 uM, MIC 13.1 uM), A. fumigatus (EC50 58.68 uM), and C. neoformans AIDS 25 (MIC<1.6 uM). Inactive against P.aeruginosa and S.aureus (MIC >100 uM). Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Cabras T et al Vitali A2008
Literature Information.Title: Structural and functional chacterization of the porcine proline-rich antifungal peptide SP-B isolated from salivary gland granules
